bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Walter Reed, December 20, 1900

div1.p: Sternberg responds to Reed's letter concerning the success of the experiments. He notes that he has received reprints of Reed's paper in the "Journal of Experimental Medicine."

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Walter Reed, December 20, 1900
div1.opener:
424
December 20, 1900.
Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon U. S. Army,
Camp Columbia, Quemados, Cuba.
My dear Doctor:-
div1.p:
I have just received your letter of Dec.
16th and am very much gratified to know that
you are getting on so well. I will look after
Acting Asst. Surgeon Cooke when his services
are no longer needed in Cuba. We have re-
ceived today 250 reprints of your paper pub-
lished in the Journal of Experimental Medicine.
I will direct Mr. Jones to send you the copies
and to retain the remainder subject to your or-
ders.
